::::Platform_Get_Mgmt_Node_String

proc  ::::Platform_Get_Mgmt_Node_String { args }
################################################################# Procedure Name: Platform_Get_Mgmt_Node_String Description: Used to determine name of management node for use in checking output of commands like "show switch" or "show slot". Input args: [-dut ] if "-dut" is omitted, then the current DUT (whichDutNow) is used. Output args: none Return value: Platform-dependent, but currently "MM" for Everest and Pioneer platforms, "Slot" for Stacking, and "MSM" for all others. Typical usage: Login $DUTs_info(DUT1,connect); set mType [Platform_Get_Mgmt_Node_String]; lappend checkList "${mtype}-A"; CheckKeyValue "show switch" $checkList; ... set mType2 [Platform_Get_Mgmt_Node_String -dut 2]; Category: Utility #################################################################
Defined in:
platform.tcl, line 182

::::Platform_GetBD8KMSMSlotList

proc  ::::Platform_GetBD8KMSMSlotList { args }
################################################################# Procedure Name: Platform_GetBD8KMSMSlotList Description: Returns a list of slots that can contain MSMs. Input args: [-dut ] If "-dut" is omitted, then the current DUT (whichDutNow) is used. Output args: none Return value: A TCL list containing the slot numbers for the device that can contain MSMs. Typical usage: set msmSlotList [Platform_GetBD8KMSMSlotList]; Category: Utility #################################################################
Defined in:
platform.tcl, line 289

::::Platform_HasMgmtIO

proc  ::::Platform_HasMgmtIO { args }
################################################################# Procedure Name: Platform_HasMgmtIO Description: Determines if the specified device supports I/O ports on the management modules. Input args: [-dut ] If "-dut" is omitted, then the current DUT (whichDutNow) is used. Output args: none Return value: 0 If the platform does not support I/O ports on the management modules. 1 If the platform does support I/O ports on the management modules. Typical usage: if {[Platform_HasMgmtIO]} { puts "Skipping test."; return; } Category: Utility #################################################################
Defined in:
platform.tcl, line 361

::::Platform_IsChassis

proc  ::::Platform_IsChassis { args }
################################################################# Procedure Name: Platform_IsChasses Description: Determine if platform is a chassis. Input args: [-dut ] if "-dut" is omitted, then the current DUT (whichDutNow) is used. Output args: none Return value: 0 if platform is not a chassis 1 if platform is a chassis ERROR message for invalid DUT number Typical usage: Login $DUTs_info(DUT1,connect); if {[Platform_IsChassis]} {...} ... if {[Platform_IsChassis -dut 2] == 1} {...} Category: Utility #################################################################
Defined in:
platform.tcl, line 76

::::Platform_IsModular

proc  ::::Platform_IsModular { args }
################################################################# Procedure Name: Platform_IsModular Description: Determine if platform is modular. Input args: [-dut ] if "-dut" is omitted, then the current DUT (whichDutNow) is used. Output args: none Return value: 0 if platform is not modular 1 if platform is modular ERROR message for invalid DUT number Typical usage: Login $DUTs_info(DUT1,connect); if {[Platform_IsChassis]} {...} ... if {[Platform_IsChassis -dut 2] == 1} {...} Category: Utility #################################################################
Defined in:
platform.tcl, line 26

::::Platform_IsPortMgmtIO

proc  ::::Platform_IsPortMgmtIO { dutPort args }
################################################################# Procedure Name: Platform_IsPortMgmtIO Description: Determines if the specified I/O port on the specified device resides on a management module. Input args: dutPort The I/O port, from the DUT's point- of-view, to check. [-dut ] If "-dut" is omitted, then the current DUT (whichDutNow) is used. Output args: none Return value: 0 If the specified port does not reside on a management module. 1 If the specified port does reside on a management module. Typical usage: set dutPort [MapDUTPortID 1 1]; if {[Platform_IsPortMgmtIO $dutPort -dut 1]} { puts "$dutPort is an MSMIO port."; } Category: Utility #################################################################
Defined in:
platform.tcl, line 440

::::Platform_IsStack

proc  ::::Platform_IsStack { args }
################################################################# Procedure Name: Platform_IsStack Description: Determine if platform is a stack. Input args: [-dut ] if "-dut" is omitted, then the current DUT (whichDutNow) is used. Output args: none Return value: 0 if platform is not a stack 1 if platform is a stack ERROR message for invalid DUT number Typical usage: Login $DUTs_info(DUT1,connect); if {[Platform_IsStack]} {...} ... if {[Platform_IsStack -dut 2] == 1} {...} Category: Utility #################################################################
Defined in:
platform.tcl, line 129

::::Platform_NumSlots

proc  ::::Platform_NumSlots { args }
################################################################# Procedure Name: Platform_NumSlots Description: Returns the number of slots for modular devices. Input args: [-dut ] If "-dut" is omitted, then the current DUT (whichDutNow) is used. Output args: none Return value: Number of slots supported by the platform. Typical usage: set numSlots [Platform_NumSlots]; set numSlots2 [Platform_NumSlots -dut 2]; Category: Utility #################################################################
Defined in:
platform.tcl, line 247
